Yeh the main EXE is still lacking any form of visual stimuli  /  eye 
candy as I've been working 'under the hood' so to speak, but the network 
drawing stuff will hopefully alliviate this a bit. The xml 
loading/saving I did last week should work just as well for passing 
genomes around a network during a distrbuted search. I recon such a 
search wouldn't actually require much data to be passed around so it 
could just as easily be distibuted over the internet as over a local 
LAN. One slight complication would be distributing co-evolution searches 
where a fitness score on one PC bares no relation to any other, thus 
making it hard for a given PC to determine if it has found a new 
best-genome or not.  I don't envisage this to be a major problem though.

Colin.
